item.title: Overgrown Tree., 22nd October
item.description:
Urgent: Immediate Action Required – Overgrown Tree Causing Damage Outside 8 Wanstead Road, Bromley BR13BL. Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing once again to raise my serious concerns regarding the large tree located on the roadside directly outside my property at 8 Wanstead Road BR13BL. I have reported this matter to Bromley Council on several occasions, yet no satisfactory action has been taken. The situation has now become critical. The tree has been allowed to grow far too large, and its roots are now actively lifting and damaging my driveway — which was only laid two years ago. The ongoing neglect of this issue is entirely unacceptable. It poses not only a risk of further root damage but also a potential hazard should the tree or any of its large branches fall. I must make it explicitly clear that any future damage to my property — whether caused by the roots, falling branches, or the tree itself — will be the full responsibility of Bromley Council. You have been notified multiple times of the risk this tree presents, and continued inaction will be regarded as negligence. I therefore require: 1. Immediate confirmation that the tree will be cut back or pruned without further delay. 2. Written assurance that Bromley Council will take full responsibility for any current and future damage caused by this tree. This matter is extremely urgent and requires prompt attention. I expect a written response within 7 days confirming the action to be taken. Failure to act or provide a satisfactory resolution will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter further through formal channels. Yours faithfully, Mr Theodorou 8 Wanstead Road, Bromley BR13BL
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wanstead Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 22nd October
item.description:
The pothole has been there for a year I would like to say. Each and every time I don’t always remember it’s there and it’s causing damage to my tyres which I am Furious about. My tyres are not cheap therefore I am Not willing to cause them damage and get them repaired all the time due to the potholes around. It is located the end of Millbrook avenue leading into Lingfield crescent turning right from Millbrook avenue into Ling field Crescent it is right there
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Lingfield Crescent, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet
